name: Port Angeles Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: Wonderful spacious clean rooms and bathrooms. Excellent price. Polite personal service. But in a mildly noisy location. Great location if you are not a light sleeper. If you are used to noise such as a large semi going by at night great place. I would stay again however I would bring earplugs just in case. Great location to Ferry just a stones throw away. But lots of traffic. Excellent restaurant downstairs!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful but Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The management has done a very nice job on this old building. My king room was clean and nicely decorated and there's original art in the hallway. Staff was friendly and helpful. One block from the Victoria ferry. Great price.
reviews.title: Good Value, Convenient to Ferry

reviews.text: This was a great deal for the money. We stayed overnight before taking the ferry to Victoria BC. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and convenient to the ferry. There is no elevator, so be prepared to carry your bags up one or 2 flights of stairs.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented the suite (Room 10) that has a great view of the harbour. Yes, it's a bit noisy from traffic and the heat has two settings: frigid and volcano, but the location is awesome. The convenient walking distance to the downtown restaurants is perfect after a day exploring Olympic National Park. Overall the hotel was excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Great cost-effective room.

reviews.text: This was one of the cheaper places to stay which was near the ferry to Victoria. We chose a room with a queen bed and its own bathroom. And that's just what we got, a bed and a bathroom, close to the ferry. Room has no closet, a tiny tv, and no phone. Room was clean and bed was reasonably comfortable. This is much closer to a B&B than a hotel. Be aware that you have to climb a large set of stairs to get to the lobby and then another set of stairs to get to the floor where most of the rooms are. There did not seem to be an elevator. Also, no AAA discount.
reviews.title: Decent price, basic lodging, no frills.
do not recommend a stay here
reviews.text: One issue i had with this hotel was the windows remain open through out the hotel as there is no Air Conditioning. That is not an issue as the weather is cool even in summers. The major issue is the sea gulls in the area have made a home on the roof of this hotel; the screaching from these birds was horrendous, they are louder than any sea gull i have ever witnessed. I actually refused to stay here, so i can not comment on whether the gulls are loud in the middle of the night but at even 8pm it was severe. The reason i refused to stay here is that the roof of the connecting building, which happens to run adjacent to many of the rooms is covered in sea gull stool. So, one peaks out the window to discover a mere few feet away, right outside your window, bird stool, and large amounts of it. Clearly little attempt has been made to clean the roof. The major issue with copious bird detriment is there are two major types of fungus that begin to thrive on such stool. This fungus becomes air borne and can lead to serious lung infections in humans, and can even lead to death in those with any immune compromise. As a physician, i was not going to stay here and risk compromising my health.

The stay at the Downtown Hotel was pretty nice. Some things to look out for if you are traveling with the elderly or with small children. --All the rooms are up two flights of stairs. They're old stairs so they were hard on my father who has had both knees replaced and one foot worked on. Once at the rooms, the windows open but have no screens - there were no issues with bugs, but being at the second floor, families with small children should be aware of that.
reviews.title: Good location, good price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was clean. VERY clean. The shared bathrooms are really really no big deal at all. They were cleaner than most regular motels I've stayed at and never once did I see anyone else in ANY of them.
reviews.title: Spacious, clean & convenient

reviews.text: The rooms are no frills. They have a tv, but no phone or AC. Windows open, as I've said, but beware if you need the windows open as the seagulls don't sleep and the truck traffic can be a bit loud. Under normal weather patterns it probably isn't a problem, but I traveled to the area the week of the record heat wave and so open windows were a must.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.text: No continental breakfast, but the corner cafe below the hotel served very nice options at a very decent price range.
reviews.title: A Unique Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the The Downtown Hotel through web searches for lodging on the Olympic Peninsula. I called to make reservations for a queen bedroom with bathroom, and asked the clerk to send me a confirmation receipt through email. Despite several emails to the hotel staff, I never received one.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but don't expect spectacular service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel at 6pm, we walked right up the stairs to the lobby (the hotel sits above a restaurant), only to find no one at the desk. There was a sign, saying to call the attendant and/or the manager and listed two phone numbers. The first was busy, and the second rang a phone sitting on the front desk before finally going to voicemail. We walked around the building, knocking on closet doors and asking other guests if they knew how to reach someone to check us in. Eventually, we just decided to take a walk around town and come back a little later.
reviews.title: Surprisingly pleasant

reviews.text: Half hour later, when we checked back in, we caught the attendant as he was returning to the desk, and were able to get checked in. Apparently, the front desk clerk is usually in one of the rooms, rather at the desk, and you have to call for him if needed. (Of course that would be no big deal, if he answered the phone calls!)
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: After our initial concerns with checking in, the rest of our stay was event-free. The room was clean and had a fan to help with cooling (and noise), so no complaints there. The ensuite bathroom had a toilet and single-person shower stall, while the sink was in the bedroom itself. Although our window looked out onto the roof next door, we could see a hint of Strait of San Juan de Fuca behind it.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: There is a small parking lot dedicated to the hotel on the next block, probably not big enough if all hotel guests need to park there, but we always got a spot.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I wanted to come to Port Angeles so I could have a central place while I went hiking during the day. I didn't spend much time looking and just decided on this place based on the price and the reviews, and the fact I just needed a place to sleep and eat.
reviews.title: Wish I could give better review, but the neighbors are talking again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Terrific value

reviews.text: -Prices are fairly good
reviews.title: Very clean, no frills accomodations for a great price.

reviews.text: -My room had its own bathroom (smaller ones do not), and was very cute like a townhouse and a nice kitchen area separate from the bedroom.
reviews.title: Perfect location to see the Olympic Peninsula!

reviews.text: -In the Middle of Port Angeles, food easy to get to.
reviews.title: Great value for solo traveler

description: A small yet elegant family-owned hotel in the heart of Port Angeles, just one block away from the Coho ferry to Victoria, BC. Recently remodeled, located in the shopping and dining center of Port Angeles, The Downtown Hotel retains its old world charm with neat and tidy rooms ranging from budget-oriented Euro-Style one-beds to a two-bedroom apartment suite with a full kitchen. Some harbor or mountain views available.
